channel.title: Some help with Beryl Please
channel.description:
[font=Tahoma]I switched to Ubuntu 7.04 from XP about a week ago, i'm liking it.. but when i installed beryl, i run it, it works ok.. but after about 5min or so it ushally crashes, can someone please help me?[/font]
I know this sounds retarded, but i don't know if my video drivers are set up yet either, i couldn't find out how..
my video card is:
ATI Technologies Inc M22 [Radeon Mobility M300]
but on the Device manager the status is status.. :D thanks for reading.

item.title: Some help with Beryl Please
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

Thank you very much for the help!

Read full topic

item.title: Some help with Beryl Please
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

That is exactly what you want, now beryl should run fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Some help with Beryl Please
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

Thanks, i did it, now when i run the command i get:

display: :0.0 screen: 0 OpenGL vendor string: ATI Technologies Inc. OpenGL renderer string: ATI MOBILITY RADEON X300 OpenGL version string: 2.0.6474 (8.38.6)

Hows that =]

Read full topic

item.title: Some help with Beryl Please
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Mesa means you do not have the proprietary ATI drivers installed, and that is why beryl is not working. A great program to use to automatically install and configure the drivers correctly is Envy:

http://www.albertomilone.com/nvidia_scripts1.html

or a direct link: http://albertomilone.com/ubuntu/nvidia/scripts/envy_0.9.5-0ubuntu5_all.deb

Read full topic

item.title: Some help with Beryl Please
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

Thanks, the results are:

display: :0.0 screen: 0 OpenGL vendor string: Tungsten Graphics, Inc. OpenGL renderer string: Mesa DRI R300 20060815 x86/MMX/SSE2 TCL OpenGL version string: 1.3 Mesa 6.5.2

Read full topic

item.title: Some help with Beryl Please
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

In the command line, type ‘fglrxinfo’ and paste the results here please.

Read full topic
